title: Join the watch.lolesports.com OPL Beta test!
body:
Hello OPL Fans!

As you hopefully know this week is super week for the OPL. Monday, Tuesday and Wednesday will each see 2x BO3 games. You can check out the full schedule [here](http://oce.lolesports.com/schedule).

Throughout the week we're going to be testing out the new stream theatre. It's in beta at the moment, so let us know how it goes. Does it add to the viewing experience? Can you see yourself using it? Simply visit [watch.lolesports.com](http://watch.lolesports.com) from 6pm AEST and you'll get to take a look at the beta stream theatre. 

Thanks for your help with this and happy esporting!

replies.body: Incredibly happy about this. I almost always miss the na/eulcs's live streams, so I never get to take advantage of the real-time stats feed those streams offer. :D
Watch.lolesports.com will be up again tonight. Any feedback will be appreciated!

For reference I am using the most recently updated version of Firefox (44.0.2)

From what I noticed watching all of last night, and so far from watching tonight, everything seems to be functioning properly, Switching from YouTube to Twitch loads quickly. The various buttons and tab respond to mouseovers/click without any sort of issue. Fonts and images are all displayed correctly even when re-sizing the page. The Stats and Schedule box relocates to under the video feed and back as well. Everything is easy to read without having to take your eye off of the game. And finally, both the pop out and hide buttons seem to be working fine. The only thing I see is that some of the player photos are not loading, but I am just assuming that it because there's no photo available for those players. (at the moment Sharp's photo is mia)

All in all I do not see anything that looks broken in any way.

Awesome feedback thank you! yes we're currently missing some pictures unfortunately.
